availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John R. Mattingly (Breckinridge County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Breckinridge County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Malinda Mattingly. Father of Theresa Mattingly, James Mattingly, Eliza Jane Mattingly, Charles Mattingly, Winny A. Mattingly, Sarah F. Mattingly, Thomas Mattingly, John William Mattingly, and Mollie Mattingly. Owned one enslaved person in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breckinridge County, District 2, p. 90. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breckinridge County, District 2, p. 99. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Breckinridge County, District 2, p. 13. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breckinridge County, Wheatleys, p. 10. Find A Grave, "John R. Mattingly (1820-1900)," Memorial #136215593, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=136215593&ref=acom (accessed June 25, 2017).
